guide.conclusion: This project first appeared in MAKE Volume 19, page 139.

flags.title: From MAKE Magazine
flags.text: This project first appeared on the pages of MAKE magazine.

guide.introduction: Many earbuds can play at high volume without distortion. Use them to drive paper cups, and the sound is surprisingly good. I first put this together when I really needed to listen to some jams at work. Put the ghetto back into the blaster!
guide.introduction_rendered:
Many earbuds can play at high volume without distortion. Use them to drive paper cups, and the sound is surprisingly good. I first put this together when I really needed to listen to some jams at work. Put the ghetto back into the blaster!

Relevant parts
  • Earbuds
  • Cups
  • Audio source
Tools
  • pocketknife

lines.text: Cut small Xs in the bottoms of 2 paper cups.
lines.text_raw: Cut small Xs in the bottoms of 2 paper cups.

lines.text: Carefully insert the earbuds into the Xs. They should fit snugly.
lines.text_raw: Carefully insert the earbuds into the Xs. They should fit snugly.

steps.title: Turn on the jams and rock out.

lines.text: See how much amplification you can get out of paper cups!
lines.text_raw: See how much amplification you can get out of paper cups!

lines.text: My earbuds do play at very high volumes without distortion … so the sound from my ghetto blaster is actually really good. This is a cheap, easy trick  and will save you serious money.
lines.text_raw: My earbuds do play at very high volumes without distortion … so the sound from my ghetto blaster is actually really good. This is a cheap, easy trick  and will save you serious money.

guide.summary: Put the ghetto back into the blaster with household items!
guide.title: Easy Boombox
